pageContext.claim: “You know, we have over 100 people under arrest, which nobody knows. I said how come nobody knows that? They said, sir, we're law enforcement people. I said they're right. They're not public relations people. But we should let people know we've arrested a lot of people. And based on the Monuments Act which is already in existence, they get 10 years in jail. … So, they want to knock out a monument or a statue. They get 10 years in prison.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump repeatedly said people arrested for vandalism during protests over the police killing of George Floyd would face 10-year sentences, but neither state nor federal authorities sought such punishment.
